intro: Monticalia leioclada, commonly known as the hairy leathery tree, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its thick, leathery leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
